title: Test
yAxis: GDP growth compared to previous year
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing GDP growth compared to previous year, with a total of 11 data points.
Overall GDP growth compared to previous year has increased over the Year.

GDP growth compared to previous year is roughly constant from 2014 to 2018, slightly increasing from 2018 to 2020, roughly constant from 2020 to 2022, slightly increasing from 2022 to 2023, and lastly roughly constant from 2023 to 2024.
The steepest increase occurs in between the Year 2022 and 2023.
Max GDP growth compared to previous year about 11.47 was recorded at Year 2024
Min GDP growth compared to previous year about 1.8 was recorded at Year 2019
This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing GDP growth compared to previous year, with a total of 11 data points. The chart has 5 significant trends.
The longest trend is slightly decreasing which exists from 2014 to 2019.
Conversely, the next significant trend is extremely increasing which exists from 2022 to 2024.
Likewise, the next significant trend is moderately constant which exists from 2021 to 2022.
On the contrary, the next significant trend is slightly decreasing which exists from 2020 to 2021.
On the other hand, the next significant trend is extremely increasing which exists from 2019 to 2020.
